result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lorne Allen Korth

records.addlTxt: E-mailed Complaint, Bail/Bond, Amended Complaint and Plea Questionnaire to Wis Dept of Justice CIB per request rec'd 10-26-22

Clerk: EZ. Defendant Lorne Allen Korth in court.  Attorney John Thomas Bayer in court for Lorne Allen Korth.  Prosecuting attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin.  (22TR1134)  State advises upon plea to Count 1, recommend Count 2 be dismissed for read-in as well as 22TR1134.  Recommendation on Count 1 upon successful completion of TAD is 7 days jail with Huber; unsuccessful recommend 30 days jail with Huber; Fine of $1,429.00; DNA sample; $33.60 blood draw fee; 12 mo. revocation & 12 month IID.  Court finds probable cause on the Amended Criminal complaint.  Guilty plea entered to Count 1, defendant admits one prior conviction.  Court finds def guilty on Count 1 and Court dismissed Count 2 for read-in.  Court admonishes defendant on bond conditions.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 5, 2023 at 09:45 am.
Sentencing hearing on April 5, 2023 at 09:45 am.

State does not oppose a signature bond and awaiting blood results to determine if there will be additional charges.  Court orders $850.00 signature bond.
